intro: Lithophragma bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's rocknettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features hairy stems and leaves with a rough, textured surface, and it produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Lithophragma bolanderi is adapted to harsh environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
